senses.eye: Brilliant tending to a straw yellow
senses.nose: Ample range of intense & fragrant citrusy aromas
senses.mouth: SDry yet well supported by the freshness of crushed rocky minerality & salt. Lengthy persistence on the palate

item.vinification: As soon as the grapes arrive to the cellars they're delicately destemmed and given a sift pressing. Then placed in temperature - controlled stainless steel fermentation tanks
item.aging: Refined 4 months in stainless steel tanks
item.pairing: Its growning area, often close to the coast, makes Vermentino a natural choice to pair with seafood starters as well as first courses, shellfish, crustaceans & fish-based main courses (baked or boiled). We suggest to try it with fresh cheeses & white meats

senses.nose: Floral/Fruity notes of grapefruit, wild strawberries, ripe apples & rosé
senses.mouth: Soft and balanced with crisp freshness & a savory finish

item.vinification: Grapes are destemmed, crushed & soft pressed to obtain a lightly colored must, left to macerate for several hours in stainless steel tanks. Alcoholic fermentation takes place in stainless steel vats at a controlled temperature not exceeding 15°C
item.aging: Refined 4 months in stainless steel tanks
item.pairing: Rosato wines such as this one pair perfectly with delicate flavors to match it's floral/fruity palate. Pair this with finger foods made with mild meats or delicate grilled fish such as shrimp or scallops. This complex fruity wine is also a perfect pairing with cheese & peppered dishes.

senses.nose: Intense & persistent bouquet with floral notes of acacia & broom. Fruity notes of peach, pear, citrus lime & orange
senses.mouth: Balanced & fruity. Expresses considerable minerality. Very long lasting aroma, with hints of chestnut honey, orange & peach

item.vinification: After a short, soft and progressive maceration of grapes, follow the decantation and alcoholic fermentation in steel with temperature controlled
item.aging: Aging in steel, on the yeast with battonage at low temperature, to maintain freshness and give structure & balance
item.pairing: Suitable for appetizers, pasta or rice with delicate sauces, seafood & vegetables

senses.eye: Light straw yellow in colour with greenish highlights. Persistent & fine perlage
senses.nose: Fruity & aromatic. Notes of apple & acacia flowers
senses.mouth: Fresh, zesty. On the palate it is fine & elegant

item.vinification: White charmat method
item.aging: Refined in stainless steel tanks for at least 30 days on fine lees “sur lie”
item.pairing: Ideal for all daily meals and for cocktails making. The fruity notes and its foam make unique and unforgettable your toasts

senses.eye: Light straw yellow in colour with greenish highlights. Persistent & fine perlage
senses.nose: Fruity & aromatic. Notes of apple & acacia flowers
senses.mouth: Fresh, zesty. On the palate it is fine & elegant

item.vinification: White charmat method
item.aging: Refined in stainless steel tanks for at least 30 days on fine lees “sur lie”
item.pairing: It's appreciated and well-know all around the word. Ideal for all daily meals and for fish disches, white meat and crustaceans. The fruity notes and its foam make unique and unforgettable your toasts

senses.eye: Intense garnet ruby red with orange reflections, tending to violet & brick over time
senses.nose: Elegant with notes of violet, small red fruits & leather
senses.mouth: Structured & harmonious, with persistent yet soft tannins

item.vinification: Standard red wine method
item.aging: Destemming-crushing in a controlled atmosphere, alcoholic fermentation at a temperature of 28-30°C with maceration for a total of about 16/20 days. After malolactic fermentation, it goes into French oak barrels for refinement of 38 months
item.pairing: Perfect with pasta dishes with mushroom or cheese sauces, red meat & game stews and pot roasts, mature cheeses

senses.nose: Notes of little red berries, plum, spices & light vanilla towards the end
senses.mouth: Well bodied, velvet, with light hints of vanilla

item.vinification: After the hand picking of the grapes they are pressed as the long maceration gives an intense & deep color
item.aging: Aged 6 months in stainless steel tanks & 6 months in oak barrels, giving this wine it's velvet characteristic
item.pairing: Best with red meat, aged cheeses, & soup

senses.eye: Straw pale yellow with golden & greenish highlights
senses.nose: Fruity with notes of pear, yellow peach, apricot, almond & acacia flowers
senses.mouth: Fresh, dry, well-balanced & fruity. Sapid wine with mineral nuances

item.vinification: White vinification preceded by a minimum of 8 hours of cryomaceration of the grapes. Followed by batonnage for 15-20 days
item.aging: In stainless steel tanks for 3 months
item.pairing: Excellent as aperitif, it goes very well with chicken based dishes, fish, crustaceans, soup and green salads. Perfect also with aged cheeses

senses.eye: Intense ruby red with reflections of violet
senses.nose: Intense & complex bouquet with shades that cross an aromatic spectrum of berries with variations of cinnamon & black pepper with strong notes of liquorice
senses.mouth: Warm alcoholic note accompanied by soft & evolved tannins of good and persistent structure

item.vinification: Fermentation using selected yeasts at a controlled temperature for 10 days with maceration on the skins and manual pumping over
item.aging: In stainless steel tanks for 6 months before further refining in the bottle for about 2 months
item.pairing: Montepulciano is best enjoyed with hearty, savory dishes such as beef brisket, hamburgers, beef bolognese, tagliatelle, ragu & high-protein pizzas. It's also a great option for grill enthusiasts pairing well with smoked or barbecued meats

senses.eye: Intense ruby red color with purple nuances
senses.nose: Warm fragrances of wild berries such as blackberry, cherry & blueberries to finish with spice notes, licorice & chocolate
senses.mouth: Great balance of power & softness. Silky texture of tannins recalling full olfactory scents

item.vinification: Fermentation using selected yeasts at a controlled temperature for 10 days with maceration on the skins and manual pumping over
item.aging: In stainless steel tanks for 6 months before further refining in the bottle for about 2 months
item.pairing: Goes particularly well with rich meats  including steaks, burgers, pork chops, veal, meatloaf, & even barbecue! The bold, acidic flavor of the wine allows it to cut through the fats, oils & richness typical of these foods

senses.nose: Intense & persistent with aromas of ripe red fruit, strong cherry, accompanied by chocolate notes
senses.mouth: Concentrated taste with refined tannic texture, slightly fresh & harmonious, mineral finish

item.vinification: Separately harvested varieties are vinified in the traditional way using selected yeasts at a controlled temperature of 23°C in stainless steel tanks, in contact with the skins for 14 days at manual pumping over
item.aging: Aging in cement tanks until the wine is fully ripe before further refining in the bottle for about 2 months
item.pairing: Goes brilliantly well with tomato sauces, pizza & pasta bakes such as lasagne but it’s also a great wine with a simple grill/roast or even a burger

senses.nose: Dry, velvety, tasty & fruity with a slight after-taste of bitter almonds, some honeysuckle & a distinct minerality
senses.mouth: Refreshingly dry with brilliant acidity & a bitter almond note on the finish. Very well-balanced & harmonious

item.vinification: Soft pressing the grapes ferment in stainless steel tanks thanks to selected yeasts for about 8 days in contact with their skins kept in suspension because of daily pumping over.At a controlled temperature of 18°C
item.aging: Refined in stainless steel tanks for 4 months on fine lees “sur lie”
item.pairing: As a delicate, neutral wine, pinot grigio pairs best with light, fresh flavours. Think summery dishes like salads, chicken, seafood, as well as light pasta dishes & risottos. Avoid heavy sauces in favour of creams/vinaigrettes

senses.eye: Light straw yellow in colour with greenish highlights. Persistent & fine perlage
senses.nose: Fruity & aromatic. Notes of apple & acacia flowers
senses.mouth: Fresh, zesty. On the palate it is fine & elegant

item.vinification: White charmat method, harvested from a more restricted area of Valdobbiadene
item.aging: Refined in stainless steel tanks for at least 90 days on fine lees “sur lie”
item.pairing: Italian classic sparkling-wine, appreciated and well-know all around the word. Ideal for all daily meals and for fish disches, white meat and crustaceans. The fruity notes and its foam make unique and unforgettable your toasts

senses.eye: Delicately rosé with good quantity of persistent bubbles & foam
senses.nose: Intense & fruity with rosé, red berries & berry notes
senses.mouth: Fresh & fragrant. The alcohol content, the sweetness & the sharpness are perfectly balanced

item.vinification: Rosé charmat method
item.aging: Refined in stainless steel tanks for at least 30 days on fine lees “sur lie”
item.pairing: Thanks to the low alcohol level it is suitable for a refreshing break, for your aperitif and for modern cocktails. Best with ice-cream, pastries and cakes

senses.nose: Scent of the woods where blackberry stands out. Wise use of wood that gives sophisticated balsamic notes mixed with nuances of tobacco & rare and precious spice
senses.mouth: Warm & sapid with an important tannic structure supported by harmonic balance

item.vinification: Destemming & subsequent pressing only at the perfect phenolic ripeness of the grapes. Fermentation with maceration at a controlled temperature of 25°C for 15 days, with pumping of over 15 minutes every 6 hours
item.aging: Approximately 20 months in barrels of 2nd and 3rd passage, in order not to yield too much tannin & wooden nuances. Completes its refining in the bottle
item.pairing: Enjoy it with roasts dishes, mature cheeses & game dishes

senses.eye: Bone color with violet hues, deep & intense
senses.nose: Blackberry, plum & hints of fresh fruit backdrop to the touches of vanilla, spice, licorice & mocha that paint a picture of great elegance & power
senses.mouth: Persistent & complex, supported by the characteristic acidity of the grape, which gives this wine length & freshness despite aging

item.vinification: Cold pre-fermentation maceration for 4 days between 0 and 4 ° C and followed by fermentation at a controlled temperature for about 10 days.
item.aging: Malolactic fermentation in stainless steel with subsequent aging of 14 months in French oak barrels
item.pairing: Particularly suited to red meats, roasts & mature cheeses

senses.eye: Intense purplish red with light garnet hues
senses.nose: Complex & harmonious spicy bouquet. The vanilla & jam nuances are the precursors of a wider range of fragrances
senses.mouth: It is voluminous with balsamic notes due to the wise use of wood, powerful but well dosed it closes with a persistent & sweet note

item.vinification: The best grapes are selected in the vineyard and vinified in stainless steel tanks for 18-20 days
item.aging: It completes the malolactic fermentation in wood where it rests for 20 months. Afterwards, the aging process is completed with 4 months of bottle refining
item.pairing: Elaborate meat preparations, game, grilled meats, mature cheeses & all great dishes of creative Tuscan cuisine. It is excellent with leg of lamb

senses.nose: Intense, complex aroma with notes of ripe fruit & elegant floral scents
senses.mouth: Full-bodied, soft, fruity flavor yet very savory & harmonious

item.vinification: Traditional red wine vinification method under 28 degrees
item.aging: 24 months in second passage barrels, 6 months further in the bottle
item.pairing: Balanced with acidity & tannin, Chianti loves both meat and tomato sauce. Pairs best with meaty dishes featuring tomato sauce, such as spaghetti & meatballs, lasagna, chicken parmesan, baked ziti,  pizza & bruschetta

senses.eye: Intense ruby red tending to garnet with aging
senses.nose: Characteristic, intense with notes of wild berries & berries
senses.mouth: Full, harmonious with a long persistence

item.vinification: The grapes are de-stemmed and softly pressed and maceration takes place in stainless steel for 20 days with pumping over & punching down. During this phase it completes the alcoholic fermentation at a controlled temperature of 30 ° C
item.aging: After completing the malolactic fermentation, the wine is placed in Slavonian oak barrels for 24-30 months, then rests 6 months in stainless steel and at least 12 months in the bottle before being put on the market 5 years after the harvest
item.pairing: Red meats & game, aged cheeses & elaborate dishes

senses.eye: Rich in colour, firmly structured but with fresh notes. This wine has personality & is also able to convey elegance and depth
senses.nose: Broad with berries, dried flowers, licorice & a spicy finale that blends well with the complexity of the wine
senses.mouth: Rich & deep, elegant yet potent at the same tim.  Still young but already very balanced

item.vinification: Natural drying for 3-4 months with a sharp drop in weight of around 30% followed by soft crushing of destemmed grapes. Fermented at a controlled temperature for about 30 days
item.aging: 24 months in large Slavonian oak barrels
item.pairing: Rich steaks & mature, intense, aged cheeses

senses.nose: Fruity, spicy with hints of blackberry, licorice & hints of black pepper
senses.mouth: The taste is full, dry, pleansant & generous

item.vinification: Pre-fermentation maceration cold and subsequent fermentation at low temperatures in stainless steel tanks at controlled temperature and oxygenation
item.aging: Refined 3 months in steel
item.pairing: Perfect with pasta dishes, raw meats , roasts & mature cheeses

senses.nose: Intense & persistent bouquet with floral notes. Fruity notes of cherry & strawberry
senses.mouth: Balanced, ground & fresh with sensation of sweet fruits

item.vinification: The grapes are softly pressed as a white and fermented to a temperature of 10/12°C for about 14 days
item.aging: Aging in steel, on the yeast with battonage at low temperature, to maintain freshness and give structure & balance
item.pairing: Suitable for appetizers, starters & fish dishes

senses.nose: Delicate fragrance of fresh fruits & spring flowers
senses.mouth: Dry, pleasantly cool, with soft flavor, moderately intense & persistent

item.vinification: After a short, soft and progressive maceration of grapes, follow the decantation and alcoholic fermentation in steel
item.aging: In steel, on the yeast with battonage at low temperature, to maintain freshness and give structure & balance. The bottling occurs from time to time, in small quantities
item.pairing: Particularly suitable for fish dishes & appetizers

senses.nose: Jasmine flowers & almond, accompanied by a slight hint of pear, peach & vanilla
senses.mouth: Good acidity that gives freshness, minerality & persistence opposing yet balancing the softness of natural light ripening grapes

item.vinification: Static racking of the must for 24 hours and subsequent fermentation in stainless steel at a controlled temperature for 2/3 of his life , completing the same in french oak barrels
item.aging: Aging for 3 months 60% in steel and 40% in new barriques (225lt) on yeast with periodic battonage
item.pairing: Particularly suited to accompany shellfish, raw fish & white meats

senses.nose: Composition of fruit, hints of chamomile, vanilla & a slight tropical note that recalls passion fruit & pineapple
senses.mouth: Strong but balanced acidity, fresh, elegant & persistent

item.vinification: The grapes are picked fully ripe, conducted in the cellar and work in a very short time to avoid problems of oxidation. Then destemmed in presence of dry ice to cool them and prevent the oxidation of precious aromas. The pressing and immediate decantation at low temperature, allow to obtain a yellow / green must with strong aromatic potential. Alcoholic fermentation in steel and barriques
item.aging: 6 months 60% in steel and 40% in new barriques (225lt) on yeast with periodic battonage
item.pairing: Particularly suitable for combinations such as chicken soup, omelets, shrimp, grilled fish

senses.eye: Deep brilliant raspberry colour, with purple rim
senses.nose: A pronounced nose with fruity (black plum and blackberry) and vanilla notes.
senses.mouth: Well-rounded palate, gourmand & fruity. This wine reveals delicious aromas of red fruits & chocolate

item.vinification: The healthy, crushed and destemmed harvest is vinified in the traditional manner. Fermentation and maceration take place at a controlled temperature, with maceration for approximately one week. Final blend integrates oaky merlot, giving roasted and vanilla hints.
item.aging: Refined 4 months in stainless steel tanks
item.pairing: Ready to drink now, this wine is best enjoyed at room temperature (18°C) to accompany a meal outside, a platter of charcuterie meats, grilled meats or a pasta meal. You can also serve it more fresh for an aperitif

senses.eye: Deep ruby colour, with raspberry rim
senses.nose: Delicate fruity nose, first evocating of berry's juice; when agitating, raspberry and blackberry notes become more intense, mingled with hot spices (cinnamon and nutmeg)
senses.mouth: Fleshy & well-balanced palate, expressing both powerful fruit and varietal elegance of Cabernet Sauvignon grapes. Fine strong finish of blackberry, blackcurrant & cocoa

item.vinification: Wine making takes place in temperaturecontrolled vats. After a short, prefermentation, maceration, the fermentation takes place a very quickly (over 4 or 5 days), and the wines are then immediately run off. This technique enables the richness and generosity of the Cabernet grapes to be fully expressed..
item.aging: Refined 4 months in stainless steel tanks
item.pairing: A perfect match to red meat, charcuterie, & hard cheese

senses.eye: Pale, livened up by salmon tints
senses.nose: The expressive bouquet is reminiscent of floral notes and fresh strawberries .
senses.mouth: A light and fruity wine that reveals delicate aromas of gourmet red fruits

item.vinification: The juice comes from complete bleeding of the vats of Grenache (after a very short maceration of 2 to 6 hours in an inert atmosphere) and is fermented at low temperatures to conserve all the delicate flavours of the Grenache variety.
item.aging: Refined 4 months in stainless steel tanks
item.pairing: Goes well with summer salads, pan-fried vegetables, grills or even red fruits dessert

senses.nose: Fairly complex, first expressing citrus notes (lime, lemon). Swirling then reveals delicate aromas of white fruits.
senses.mouth: Great balance. The perfect ripeness of grapes brings notes of cooked apricots & pears

item.vinification: The grapes are pressed using a pneumatic press. The musts of the resultant juice are left to settle under cold conditions (8°C). Alcoholic fermentation takes place in temperature controlled vats (18°C), started off by the addition of yeasts which are specially selected for their ability to bring out the aromas of the Gros Manseng.
item.aging: Refined 4 months in stainless steel tanks
item.pairing: Amazing with blue cheese, couscous or cooked prune lamb

senses.nose: a nose packed with powerful fresh fruit aromas as lemon, nectarine and pear
senses.mouth: The attack is lively & fruity, with prominent citrus notes building to a fresh, soft and clean finish

item.vinification: The wine is aged in stainless steel vat to preserve freshness and fruit flavors.
item.aging: Refined 4 months in stainless steel tanks
item.pairing: Grilled fish, vegetables, chicken salad and goat cheese

senses.nose: peach and crips lime freshness
senses.mouth: With fresh & crisp citrus aromas while the core of white peach and white nectarine fruit glides through easily, picking up verbena & tangerine echoes on the finish

item.vinification: Mechanical harvest with traditional Bordeaux white winemaking. All berries are pressed in a temperature controlled vat to preserve freshness, acidity, fruit flavors  and vivacity.
item.aging: Refined 4 months in stainless steel tanks
item.pairing: Perfect for aperitif, with seafood, vegetables, white meats or fish

senses.eye: Beautiful ruby color, deep and brillant
senses.nose: expressive and delicious with notes of ripe black fruits and raspberry jam
senses.mouth: Smooth attack, fruity aromas of black current & dark cherries

item.vinification: The grapes, picked at perfect maturity, are de-stemmed and lightly crushed. The maceration, which lasts about 15 days, is done by controlling the temperatures. The draining is decided when the balance of the wine is achieved. The wine is then matured in stainless steel tanks for 6 to 8 months.
item.aging: Refined 4 months in stainless steel tanks
item.pairing: This wine will be excellent with dishes of white meat (chicken, turkey…) & a variety of cheeses

senses.eye: A crystalline, very pale yellow colour
senses.nose: Intense and fairly complex, first expressing the varietal notes of the Colombard (lime, lemon) and a delicate mineral hint (flint). Swirling then reveals white fruit aromas mingling with floral notes (acacia, wisteria)
senses.mouth: Lively and fleshy in the attack, great balance. In the finish the lemon & peach notes include a subtle hint of green mango

item.vinification: The grapes are pressed using a pneumatic press. The musts of the resultant juice are left to settle under cold conditions (8°C). Alcoholic fermentation takes place in temperature controlled vats (18°C), started off by the addition of yeasts which are specially selected for their ability to bring out the aromas of the Chardonnay and Colombard grapes.
item.aging: Refined 4 months in stainless steel tanks
item.pairing: This wine makes an ideal aperitif & is the perfect partner to fish cooked in a sauce

senses.eye: Deep brilliant raspberry colour, with purple rim
senses.nose: Pronounced fruity nose with blackberry, ripe black plum and a hint of black pepper
senses.mouth: Well-rounded palate, balanced between fleshy structure & fruity character (cooked plums & blueberries)

item.vinification: The healthy, crushed and destemmed harvest is vinified in the traditional manner. Fermentation and maceration take place at a controlled temperature, with maceration for approximately one week.
item.aging: Refined 4 months in stainless steel tanks
item.pairing: Platter of charcuterie meats, grilled steak & ragou

senses.nose: An intense nose of peony and red fruits
senses.mouth: Rich mouthfill, structured & full of expression

item.vinification: The grapes are vinified in the traditional way: natural alcoholic fermentation, long vatting, pumping over twice a day. The tanks of wine making are in stainless steel with thermal regulation.
item.aging: Refined 4 months in stainless steel tanks
item.pairing: Ideal on a lasagna dish or a pork roast

senses.eye: Consistent, vibrant, ruby-red robe with a raspberry halo
senses.nose: Elegant and still slightly understated, with blackberry and grilled meat aromas accented with a subtle hint of menthol
senses.mouth: Balanced, elegant & dense. Black fruits & undergrowth notes, peppered with nicely-rounded roasted aromas

item.vinification: Vinification using traditional methods: natural alcoholic fermentation, long vatting, pumping over twice daily. The vats are stainless steel, with temperature control systems.
item.aging: Refined 4 months in stainless steel tanks
item.pairing: Perfect with braised or jugged meats red meats

senses.nose: Ripe blackberries with hint of cofee
senses.mouth: Full-bodied & ripe with a fine, well-balanced finish

item.vinification: grapes sorted by hand at the winery, plot-by-plot selection, temperature control, vatting time of around 3 weeks,
item.aging: Refined 4 months in stainless steel tanks
item.pairing: Goes well with grilled chicken, red meats & cheese

senses.nose: full-bodied nose rich in candied fruit aromas
senses.mouth: The mouth is structured, full of character, long & balanced

item.vinification: Traditional Bordeaux winemaking in tanks.
item.aging: Refined 4 months in stainless steel tanks
item.pairing: The richness of this wine will be appreciated with roasted or grilled meats

senses.nose: On the nose, small red fruits, especially raspberry, hints of laurel, iodized nuances ending on notes of eucalyptus
senses.mouth: The mouth reveals its juiciness, density & crunchiness. Iodized tannins, very long persistence. Small red fruits notes in the aftertaste

item.vinification: Whole batch all together in stainless steel tank.
item.aging: 60% new French oak for 15 months
item.pairing: Red & white meats, cheeses & barbecue

senses.nose: Intense, with black-fruit and vanilla notes.
senses.mouth: Black-fruit flavors (cassis, blueberry) mingle with notes of roasted coffee & vanilla, giving the wine complexity, power & roundness

item.vinification: Vatting for 3 weeks in stainless steel vats. Cooling by run-off.
item.aging: Maturing for 10 months in casks, one-third of which are one-wine barrels
item.pairing: Grilled steak, stew lamb, hard cheese & Daube

senses.eye: elegant, very pale, brilliant bluish pink colour
senses.nose: The nose is intense and fresh with notes of English candy. Redcurrant blends with raspberry, pear and banana in a fine and delicate bouquet
senses.mouth: The palate is fresh & rich, with a subtle balance between crunchy fruitiness, volume in the mouth & aromatic persistence

item.vinification: There is great potential for fruitiness and freshness. The grapes are harvested when just ripe and then destemmed (separating the grapes themselves from the green parts). The grapes spend a short period (a few hours) being macerated before being placed in vats.
item.aging: Refined 4 months in stainless steel tanks
item.pairing: Premius Rosé is here to breathe some fresh air into relaxing breaks. Whether with an oyster platter by the seaside, sat next to the fireplace, or alongside lunch out on the terrace, I have more than one ace up my sleeve to ensure a break that is anything but ordinary. Perfect to enjoy by the pool, with tapas or antipasti, Premius Rosé will also accompany your exotic salads, sushi and barbecues with friends.

senses.nose: Fresh and balance, with aromas of fresh strawberry, sweet orange and white flowers
senses.mouth: Direct pressing of de-stemmed grapes after harvesting only in the coolest hours of the morning to preserve the fruitiness and a pale color. Cold pre-fermentation stabilization for 1 week followed by a temperature controlled fermentation

item.vinification: Direct pressing of de-stemmed grapes after harvesting only in the coolest hours of the morning to preserve the fruitiness and a pale color. Cold pre-fermentation stabilization for 1 week followed by a temperature controlled fermentation
item.aging: Refined 4 months in stainless steel tanks
item.pairing: Grilled chicken, vegetables, summer dishes & fruits dessert

senses.nose: Charming and elegant balck berries notes and smoky hints
senses.mouth: Vibrant & intense ripe fruit flavors. Red berries &dark cherries with spicy notes.

item.vinification: Sustainable viticulture, favored ploughing and grass cover crop. Fermentation in temperature controlled concrete tanks, operations according to daily tasting
item.aging: 100% in oak barrels for 12 months with 27 % of new barrels, 27 % of one year old barrels and 46% of two years old barrels
item.pairing: Duck confit or beef entrecôte

senses.nose: Complex and distinguished nose. Floral, aniseed and mineral, the nose evolves towards notes of verbena, lemon, grapefruit with a touch of hazelnut, reflecting the barrel ageing
senses.mouth: The mouth has a nice tension & we find mineral & citrus notes, evolving on yellow fruits with aeration. The finish is fresh with citrus & lime

item.vinification: Bordeaux winemaking
item.aging: 10% new oak  / 90% old oak barrels for 9 monts
item.pairing: Best with vegetables, especially roasted vegetables & fish

senses.eye: Light yellow color with pale green tints.
senses.nose: Intense and complex nose of exotic white fruits and citrus fruit mixed with floral notes of linden and acacia
senses.mouth: The palate is rich, generous, ample & intensely fruity, with very good tension

item.vinification: The winemaking practices at Clos des Lunes take inspiration from those of Domaine de Chevalier, and benefit from an expertise in creating impressive dry white wines. Just like at Chevalier, the harvest at Clos des Lunes is carried out by hand, with extreme care and several passes through the vines as the grapes reach maturity. In the winery, the purity of the fruit therefore allows for a simple, natural vinification that enables the individual properties of the terroir to reveal themselves. Following the precise and plot-by-plot approach to harvesting, vinification takes place in small thermo-regulated vats of 50 hectolitres or in barrels. This is determined according to the quality of wine, following a very gentle, slow pressing of the grapes.
item.aging: Regulated vats of 50 hectolitres or in barrels
item.pairing: Try a white fish, like halibut, with roasted carrots or zucchini. Also perect white white meats & seafood

senses.nose: Classic Sauvignon Blanc aromas centered on grapefruit, passion fruit & guava, followed by an elegant herbal finale
senses.mouth: The flavors are elevated by a crisp acidity & a tantalizingly lingering tail

item.aging: 9 months in stainless steel tank, cold stabilization
item.pairing: Cheeses, seafood or dishes with rich white sauces

senses.nose: Mainly floral with lime peel & apricot coming through, followed by a hint of natural rubber
senses.mouth: Fully dry wine, with apple, pear & stone fruit notes brightened by a crisp acidity

item.pairing: Vegetarian dishes with light or no sauces, seafood, chicken & pasta dishes. A great combination with Middles-Easter dishes

senses.nose: An elegant fruit married to floral notes, with aromas of toasted wheat & grilled bread
senses.mouth: Zesty & refreshing on the palate

item.aging: 12 months in 2nd and 3rd passage French oak barrels
item.pairing: Creamy/buttery cheeses, foie gras, chicken & lamb dishes with fruits, spicy/creamy curries & rich shellfish dishes

senses.nose: Ripe strawberries & blueberries touched by lightly toasted oak, warm spices such as cloves & cinnamon
senses.mouth: Soft red fruits, cedar wood, with some herbal notes elevated by a bright acidity & a lingering tail centered on blackcurrant flavors

item.pairing: Rich grilled meats, meat stews, boeuf bourguignon, escargot, peppery sauces, dishes with high flavor

senses.nose: Chewy tannins envelop a biting, complex fruit with opulent notes of ripe red & black fruits balanced with some spice
senses.mouth: Good acidity and balance between attack, middle & finish on a palate which confirms the nose

item.pairing: Rich grilled meats, peppery sauces & dishes with high flavor

senses.nose: Soft tannins envelop a complex fruit kissed by oak, with notes of cassis, black fruits & spices
senses.mouth: Good acidity and balance between attack, middle & finish on a palate which confirms the nose

item.aging: 12 months in 2nd and 3rd passage French oak barrels
item.pairing: Rich grilled meats, peppery sauces, dishes with high flavor, Middle-Eastern dishes & game meats

senses.nose: Complex & very elegant with notes of ripe black fruits married to velvety oak tannins
senses.mouth: Good acidity to balance the fruitiness and a remarkable equilibrium between attack, mid-palate & finish

item.aging: 12 months in French oak barrels
item.pairing: Rich grilled meats & vegetables, braised beef, aged hard cheeses, barbecued glazed chicken, duck, tuna & game meats

senses.nose: Ripe red & black fruits followed by oak
senses.mouth: Blackberries, red currant, raspberries & spices supported by well-rounded fruit & oak tannins. Good balance between attack, mid-palate & finish, though slightly greater emphasis on the mid-palate through finish

item.aging: 12 months in French oak barrels
item.pairing: Rich grilled meats & vegetables, braised beef, aged hard cheeses, barbecued glazed chicken, duck, tuna & game meats

senses.nose: White flowers, candied cherries, allspice berries & some cinnamon
senses.mouth: Fully dry wine exhibiting juicy berry flavors, rounded acidity that lingers slightly, remarkable balance on the palate from attack to tail

item.aging: 9 months in stainless steel tank, cold stabilization
item.pairing: Light salads, light pasta dishes & seafood

item.grapeVariety: Sauvignon Blanc, Viognier, Muscat Blancà Petits Grains

senses.nose: Expressive nose & floral aromas with expression of sweetness
senses.mouth: Balanced harmony of acidity & a strong, intense yet delicate flavor

item.pairing: Salads, wide varieties of sea food and shellfish (fruit de mer), roasted grilled chicken, veal, pork, spicy flavors, asian cuisine & even salty blue cheese

senses.nose: Smells of red fruits & raspberries
senses.mouth: Full bodied with a smooth & rich aftertaste, no acidity, quite simple & agreeable

item.pairing: Meat & aged cheese

senses.nose: Nuances of berries & a floral bouquet
senses.mouth: Fruity & fresh, strong in the mouth with good vivacity

item.pairing: Lasagna, pizza, dishes with Italian tomato-based sauces, grilled meat & smoky dishes

item.productName: Le Rouge de Marje - Limited Release

senses.eye: Distinctive red color with intense & fresh reflections
senses.nose: The particular blend of Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon & Merlot fuses harmoniusly the fruity & elegant aromas
senses.mouth: Fresh flavours & a rounded, smooth tannin structure

item.pairing: Beef, duck breast & special cheeses of character

senses.nose: Aromas of black fruits & tobacco
senses.mouth: Depth of flavor from the oak rounded by freshness of black fruits, slight bitter, dry aftertaste

item.pairing: Red meat, game, ripened cheese (fromage affiné) & cold cuts (charcuterie)
